poem:
Title: "The Great Unraveling"

Pizzolatto hangs by the thread of a sentence,
In the tired weave of his own discontent.
Where once was a story, woven with finesse,
Now lies a tapestry of regret.
Men whine on the internet's wide loom,
As creator becomes the critic of his own room.
Oh, True Detective, in your first season's bloom,
Who knew your architect would become your doom.
